Sentencas: Ce0.6La0.4O2 (LDC) is a promising buffer layer for preventing chemical reactions between a doped-LaGaO3 electrolyte and Ni-based anode in intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Performance of La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-based SOFCs with atmospheric plasma sprayed La-doped CeO2 buffer layer

Sentencas: In the present work, first, the chemical compatibility between La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3 (LSGM) powders and LDC powders is evaluated.
Titulo: Performance of La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-based SOFCs with atmospheric plasma sprayed La-doped CeO2 buffer layer

Sentencas: Subsequently, an LDC buffer layer is prepared via atmospheric plasma spraying (APS) at different deposition temperatures using powders that have particle sizes larger than 30 mm.
Titulo: Performance of La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-based SOFCs with atmospheric plasma sprayed La-doped CeO2 buffer layer

Sentencas: The effects of deposition temperature on the microstructure and ionic conductivity are investigated.
Titulo: Performance of La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-based SOFCs with atmospheric plasma sprayed La-doped CeO2 buffer layer

Sentencas: Cells with an optimized APS LDC interlayer between the NiO containing anode and LSGM electrolyte are tested with humidified H-2 as fuel and ambient air as the oxidation.
Titulo: Performance of La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-based SOFCs with atmospheric plasma sprayed La-doped CeO2 buffer layer

Sentencas: At 750 degrees C, the maximum power density of cells with the APS LDC interlayer is 460 mW/cm(2).
Titulo: Performance of La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-based SOFCs with atmospheric plasma sprayed La-doped CeO2 buffer layer

Sentencas: In addition, a stability test of similar to 400 h at 650 degrees C under a constant current density of 250 mW/cm(2) is carried out, and the cell with the optimized APS LDC interlayer is stable.
Titulo: Performance of La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-based SOFCs with atmospheric plasma sprayed La-doped CeO2 buffer layer

Sentencas: Therefore, APS is a viable alternative approach for fabricating an LDC interlayer for SOFCs using the LSGM electrolyte.
Titulo: Performance of La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-based SOFCs with atmospheric plasma sprayed La-doped CeO2 buffer layer
